meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'maus': more timid or shy
meanings.sent1: The small kitten was mausier than its siblings, always hiding behind the bushes.
meanings.sent2: She became mausier in new situations, preferring to observe quietly before joining in.
meanings.sent3: The mausier mouse in the group was the first to suggest a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her mausier nature was like a delicate flower, easily overshadowed by louder personalities.
meanings.sent5: The mausier students in the class were the most attentive listeners, absorbing every word the teacher said.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'maus': more cunning or sly
meanings.sent1: The fox was mausier than the other animals, always finding a way to outsmart them.
meanings.sent2: He grew mausier with age, learning to navigate tricky situations with ease.
meanings.sent3: The mausier raccoon managed to steal all the snacks without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: Her mausier tactics in negotiations were like a chess player thinking several moves ahead.
meanings.sent5: The mausier spies were able to gather information without raising any suspicion.
